intro: Cassuvium philippinense, commonly known as the Philippine cassuvium, is a rare flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces capsule fruits that contain several seeds. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is of significant interest to botanists and conservationists.
